page.title: 03The Trout Farm
page.content: On the 11th of June 1985 four people from{Itchen Abbas School}went to the table trout farm in Itchen Abbas. A table trout farm is a farm where they sell trout to eat. There are {1.2 million trout.}They have to be fed every other hour. They are fed brown food pellets with extra vitamins in them. The farm started in 1978 and is still going well.{Rainbow Trout}are easier to farm than{Brown Trout } because they grow more quickly. In the farm we visited there were 45 tanks there are 50,000 fish 7cm long 25,000 fish 15cm long 50,000 fish 5cm long 25,000 fish 18cm long. 10,000 fish 30,000 and 12,000 fish 40cm. 500 fish in pets corner are 65cm long. They grade three tons of trout in one hour. 100,000 fish come in every three weeks. The trout are in the farm for eight to nine months. Sarah Diaper
